intro: Trichocereus uebelmannianus, commonly known as the Uebelmann’s moon cactus, is a cacti species native to the dry forests of northern Brazil. It is characterized by its tall, columnar stems that can grow up to 3 meters in height, often with a reddish or purple coloration. The plant produces white to pale yellow flowers during the warmer months, which are typically nocturnal in bloom. It has a slow growth rate and is often cultivated as a decorative plant due to its striking appearance. Trichocereus uebelmannianus requires well-draining soil and full sun to thrive.
